thread.section_title: Liverpool target Inaki Williams reveals he’s modelling his game on Cristiano Ronaldo and Gareth Bale – Metro
thread.title: Liverpool target Inaki Williams reveals he’s modelling his game on Cristiano Ronaldo and Gareth Bale
thread.title_full: Liverpool target Inaki Williams reveals he’s modelling his game on Cristiano Ronaldo and Gareth Bale

author: jsgoldman
title: Liverpool target Inaki Williams reveals he’s modelling his game on Cristiano Ronaldo and Gareth Bale
text:
Inaki Williams has a buyout clause of £42.5 million (Picture: Getty) Liverpool target Inaki Williams has revealed he is modelling his game on Gareth Bale and Cristiano Ronaldo.
Wenger embarrasses himself by comparing Arsenal flop to Kante The Spain international has emerged as one of the fastest players in world football and has been regularly linked with a move to Liverpool in the last 12 months.
Williams signed a new contract with Athletic Bilbao last January which included a €50m release clause.
The winger believes he is worth every penny of that valuation, but concedes he still has some way to go before he can be compared with the Real Madrid Galacticos.
Ronaldo and Bale are in line to face Williams when Real Madrid take on Athletic Bilbao at the San Mames on Saturday (Picture: Getty) Asked if he studied Ronaldo’s game, he told AS: ‘He’s absolutely lethal, he has so many qualities – and all of them go into the mix: he’s ambitious, hard-working. He deserves all of the credit he has received for the career he’s had.’
More: Football Arsene Wenger reveals Mesut Ozil's Arsenal heartbreak 
Conte admits this Chelsea star has totally won him over 
Conspiracy! Wenger believes Arsenal star is being unfairly targeted 
And questioned whether or not he had similar qualities to Bale, he added: ‘He’s amazing in the air – the way he heads the ball is spectacular and he has a really powerful left foot shot. Both of them have amazing pace and they’re very powerful.’
On his buyout clause, he said: ‘I set that price based on what I did last season. I’ve always been very up-front, I’m happy and so is my family; I have the best coach, the best fans and the best team mates.’
MORE: Arsenal and Liverpool told to pay £26 million to sign Naby Keita from RB Leipzig
